website_summaries.verdict: The budget-friendly Canon PowerShot SX130 IS is a solid, compact megazoom for those who prize creative control and photo quality more than fast shooting performance or a small, lightweight design.
pros: Excellent photo quality, features for its class

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I use this camera for EVERYTHING. I purchased it mainly to take pictures at concerts but I use it all the time. It has a great zoom and if your hands don't shake you can take some pretty impressive pictures at concerts. It does not work as well for action shots but again, if you are patient and take a lot of shots you get some great action shots too. I've also got great shots from the car just driving down the road and snapping as someone is driving. And of course it is perfect for still shots of people or things. For the price it is an excellent camera.
customer_reviews.author: S B

customer_reviews.title: ... are getting hard to find but they do a great job on everything I shoot
customer_reviews.text: These are getting hard to find but they do a great job on everything I shoot. Really impressed on zoom along with macro operations. Ye need rechargeable batteries as she gobbles them up. But grab and shoot makes it all worth whiled.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Jack

customer_reviews.title: GOOD USED CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS MY 4TH USED CAMERA-- BOUGHT USED CARS ALL MY LIFE, WHY NOT USED CAMERAS-- BEEN LUCKY BUT SO FAR THEY HAVE WORKED WELL --- THIS 12x CAMERA IS A BACK UP FOR THE ONE i USE-- GOOD FEEL, GOOD PHOTOS-- ALSO SHOOT LOT OF SHORT FILMS FOR MY CHANNEL donze52 on you tube with 14 million views- don't be afraid of used cameras--
customer_reviews.author: Tracey D.

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: I would say this is not a REALLY good camera, but I love. It takes good quality pictures. It is not fast but does what it is for: Take Pictures. I have it as a back-up gear. Whenever I need to send my DSLR to Canon for repair, or simply I am not willing to carry heavy equipment, then I use this camera. I really recommend it if your purpose is like mine.
customer_reviews.author: Javier G. Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Super high quality camera.  Super great photos and movies after over 5 years and still works great.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a great camera. I originally purchased this camera in 2010, and I've used it a lot since then. I've taken it overseas, and all around the States. I've taken it to the Grand Canyon, to the Philippines, and numerous other places. It's rugged, it works extremely well for photos and movies. I've captured so many memories with this excellent camera. I'm completely satisfied with my purchase, and after over 5 years, it still works like new. I swapped out the SD card recently for a larger storage, but that's about all I've needed. This camera has been one of the best purchases I've ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Stone Polisher

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot SX130IS
customer_reviews.text: While there is a newer model out I couldn't pass up the great price. It still has great specifications for the price. It's small enough to fit in my fanny pack for those family vacation pictures. I can get plenty of pictures and video with the 32GB SIM card that I have installed. I can put the camera in auto mode and shoot just about any pictures from scenic to action pictures of my daughter playing softball. The only complaint I have is that it just eats batteries. But then it is a common issue with point and shoot cameras. Stay with the higher end batteries, they may cost more but they'll at least last longer than the cheaper ones.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Liguori

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent camera and easy to use. I expecially like the flash feature. The flash won't fire unless you raise it. I like the big LCD screen to review pictures. I would like to advise everyone to use the wrist strap. I didn't with the first one and dropped it on a hard floor and ruined the lens. This time I purchased a camera warranty which will replace the camera or pay for repairs. I liked the first Canon enough to buy another one almost like the first. I really like the 12X zoom lens. I haven't found anything about this camera I don't like.
customer_reviews.author: E A T B

customer_reviews.title: Canon Power Shot
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I've had 5 in the last 2 years and this one is the only one that still works after a few photos. I hope it keeps working.
customer_reviews.author: marc999us

customer_reviews.title: Just a great camera
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera for 19 months now and I continue to be amazed by the quality of the pictures that this camera takes. I was looking for a high megapixel camera with good zoom but was almost scared off by comments about battery life. The battery life has been excellent and I like the fact that if I carry two extra double A batteries with me I am back in business immediately. Close up pictures on the auto setting are particularly excellent. I would highly recommend this camera for anyone looking for something other than a camera with interchangeable lenses.
customer_reviews.author: WF

customer_reviews.title: Best pocket camera ever.
customer_reviews.text: User friendly and no tricks! Best cameras I have had for a pocket camera. This is my second one of this type and I love the ability to pull it out of my pocket, shoot a video or still pic and have it create photo that look like the real thing. Easy to download my photos to the computer also. I put a 64 gb memory card in it and when I go on a 2 week vacation I can shoot thousands of shots and have room left. The best part is it runs on AA batteries and no recharging. Just keep 2 AA batteries for emergency use and its off and shooting pics.
customer_reviews.author: FRED H.

customer_reviews.title: Its a good camera but slow flash recharge time
customer_reviews.text: I use this camera heavily for work and take at least 1000 photos per week. Closeups, far, high zoom, delay, the whole bit. It takes great photos most of the time. The autofocus has a lot of trouble but not any more than any other powershot I've used in the past. I use the newest version of regular Sanyo eneloops and have no trouble taking 300 flash shots within a 2 hour period of time. This camera does, however, have up to a 10 second delay between flash shots which is somewhat annoying for my purpose because I'm just continually shooting. Using SanyoXXX batteries doesn't seem to help with the flash recharge time.
customer_reviews.author: Atomic1

customer_reviews.title: Great for lighted areas, but flash takes a long time to recharge
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera for over a year. It is wonderful and easily takes great pictures. My only complaint is it takes a long time for the flash to recharge between pictures. This is inconvenient when I am taking pictures of my kids and have to wait several seconds between shots. I expected the camera to take pictures more quickly from one picture to the next, which it does when you are not using the flash. I would not consider this a compact camera. I cannot put it in my back pocket and it is much thicker than my old PowerShot camera.
customer_reviews.author: MJCJ

customer_reviews.title: very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Many products report to be the best and often they turn up not so good. The Canon Power Shot SX is the easiest and best features in a camera I have ever used. Back when using older digital cameras ment figuring out how to use it and waiting for the slow shutter to complete the picture. Being a senior also ment trying to figure out how to use new contraptions. My overview is, "well done Canon", fast shutter, large screen, good timer, larger lens, and easy to understand instructions. Thanks to amazon for offering a fair price for a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing camera
customer_reviews.text: Everyone loved this camera whoever saw it. Its extended zoom upto 48x is just so amazing that you got to see it yourself to believe it. Can take distant pictures with it that you can't even see that far. Simply the best camera owned until. It just consumes a little more battery power that's it. But worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: Pros: An excellent performer for the home user. Takes amazing photos. Powerful zoom lens 12x Close ups are also awesome. Takes good High Def video. (video is full screen when playing back on computer) Can zoom in and out slowly while recording video. Good enough to substitute for video camera for basic video tasks. Image stabilizer during video works well. Dramatically reduces "shaky" video. Uses ordinary AA batteries Very pleased Cons: A bit too bulky for the shirt pocket. Eats batteries rapidly. You need to use Lithium or rechargables. Lag time between photos.
customer_reviews.author: reviewer155

customer_reviews.title: Bought it as a gift.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my folks for the holidays. They can both use it and like it... Not to mention they are taking great pictures with it! It's all the camrea they say they will ever need and then some. They do not think they will ever need another camera. On is tech savy the other is not. And it the one that is not that has used this camera the most. Though I learned to love Canons from them. Even though right now I do not personally own one, doesn't mean they don't still know how to make great products.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: This camera is amazing! I was so excited when I received it and so impressed how well it was shipped and how FAST it was delivered. I would recommend this camera to amateurs and professionals alike because it takes such creative and beautiful photos. I have always been impressed at how fast Amazon gets my products to me and how I am never disappointed in anything I purchase. Amazon personnal have always been informative, friendly and patient. Thank you to the seller and to Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for my elderly mother in law as she was finding it difficult to get good quality processing with print film. She learned the basics of it but when she found a better processing place she switched back to film. My 13 year old daughter now has it and is using the video and still features to shoot stop motion videos for Youtube. It takes really good quality images and is simple to use with more features than many people will ever use. I've had past experience with Canon on technical issues and they have excellent customer service and repaired my other 6 year old camera at no cost due to an OEM component that failed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Finch

customer_reviews.title: Bad battery life.  Nice pictures.
customer_reviews.text: Bad battery life. Nice pictures. Good Zoom. Easy for me to work with. It works but complains about the slightly lower voltages of NiMh batteries. I usually get about an hour from a AA pair. But I must put up with the low battery warning almost the whole time. I do like the quality of Canon PowerShot pics compared to most other brands. I just keep changing batteries. I've been using for about 2 years now. Still going strong. Takes the standard big old clunky SD Card which is flexible thanks to adaptors.
customer_reviews.author: JASON R KEITER

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as decribed. Thank you.
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I wanted and came exactly as described. Works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Martin

customer_reviews.title: This point and shoot takes great pics and uses 2 AA batteries
customer_reviews.text: This point and shoot takes great pics and uses 2 AA batteries. If you travel internationally and can't guarantee a place to charge your camera, or buy fancy batteries, this is the one for you. Perfect for Peace Corps. I take it back to West Africa (my Peace Corps village) where I can load up on AA batteries in the market if need be, and leave any unused batteries in the village for everyone else to use in their flashlights and radios.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: Works good but you need to use really good batteries for this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Canon Power Shot SX130IS
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little camera. I own a Canon Rebel, but wanted something a could put in my pocket. It has a very nice zoom lens for a small point and shoot. The pictures are very good - crisp and clear. The shutter is fast and snaps when you push the button - no waiting which is something important to me. I have not taken any video yet...but look forward to trying it.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.  Many features.
customer_reviews.text: Feature packed camera is really easy to use, two auto modes (regular and easy), with full manual control for special shots. Quick startup. I especially like the dial on the control buttons for easy adjustments. Large bright screen. Pop-up flash eliminates flash guesswork. Up and it's on, down and it's off. Also, the flash is uniform over the whole field, even in large rooms. Great HD video with zoom. Uses rechargeable AA batteries, a big plus for me.
customer_reviews.author: C. Burton

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: this is my 4th digital camera, and i thought i'd spend a little more to hopefully get something more than a simple 'point and click'. it looked a little bulky and heavy, but it's well worth it so far. i've never been able to take a good photo at night, but got some great night shots during a snow storm this weekend. was also able to get some great action shots of my dog running through the snow. it can be challenging to shoot a white dog on snow, but this camera did an amazing job with it. summary: worth the additional price compared to your basic point and click camera.
customer_reviews.author: ToRo78

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere in this price range
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a different Canon camera and used it all the time. After I eagerly bought this I lost the urge for photography altogether. Tried to shoot in a concert (very dimly lit room) and this camera could not take a clear, bright, and immersive picture. Tried taking pictures of objects in motions and this camera could not do that. Good camera if you're taking still pics in a well-lit area. Night pictures come out pretty mediocre. I expected more from the brand and from the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Willowflowerfull

customer_reviews.title: It always take excellent pictures
customer_reviews.text: I like to use a camera that uses batteries that you do not charge in the wall.
customer_reviews.author: MARLENE

customer_reviews.title: Great, great camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is an excellent option for anyone looking to take professional quality pictures without having to drag along lots of different lenses, etc. It has an excellent zoom range, and the clarity of pictures at maximum zoom (48x) is excellent. It's ability to go from fully automatic to fully manual is also a big plus and helps to give all different photographers of all different skill levels an excellent camera that, again, doesn't require one to carry tons of equipment. The price is unbelievable and to me this is the best buy in digital point and shoot cameras. The only thing that would make it better is if it could be made waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: D. Melissa Carter

customer_reviews.title: FABULOUS EASY TO USE CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this camera. It looks professional, sturdy metal construction, easy to handle, fits the hand well. Very easy to use with a variety of settings but "auto" really deals with every situation. The 12x zoom is incredible and actually brings you closer than 12 with crisp, clear pictures. I like having AA battery power and Lithium batteries seem to last forever. The screen is large and clear, although I would like a viewfinder too. This is a GREAT camera for less than $200. One small inconvenience is having to manually raise the flash--no big deal. BUY THIS CAMERA--YOU CAN'T DO BETTER.
customer_reviews.author: MG ROBERTSON MD

customer_reviews.title: SX series is great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my SX110. I did not like it as much, felt like it was harder to get a picture in focus. Long battery life. Only have to use 2 batteries. I would take 2 sets of rechargeables and rarely had to use the 2nd set. I shoot for usually 2 hours at a time, consistently and most always with flash. Can easily get 500+ pics per charge.
customer_reviews.author: L. Case

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bang for the buck. Picture quality is excellent and image stabilization works well as advertised. Loved the zoom feature, which I used extensively on a trip last week. While the LED screen is large, I miss the viewfinder from my old camera when in bright sunlight. The one thing I'm not as enamored with is the image transfer process, using the supplied software. It's not as automatic and straightforward as my old Nikon Coolpix 3200, though I can figure it out with a little effort. Some complained about battery power use, but it seems okay to me. Unless I was going to upgrade significantly in price and features, I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona Adventurer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding general purpose digital camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera in early 2011 for an epic trip through Central and South America and after visiting 16 countries and shooting ~25GBs worth of photos, frequently under less than ideal conditions (for a camera), I can state with conviction that this camera will not let you down. Coupled with rechargeable batteries and a charger, I would challenge anyone to find a better performing camera for the price. Pros: - Price - Durability - Ease of use - Low light performance - Image stabilization - Zoom performance Cons: - No optical view finder - Somewhat kludgy and limited video capabilities
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: disappointed in the end
customer_reviews.text: nice camera for its price, but once it stops working, say goodbye to the unit. i had mine for now over 15 months everything was ok, but suddenly it stopped working, with no apparent reason. tried to call CANON, their suggestion to me was to send the unit to their repair center in the East and for about 135$ plus 2 way shipping with insurance of course, they told me they will try to fix the problem. the new one on AMAZON costs about 145$. what a great idea from CANON.
customer_reviews.author: vartan

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: After working with P&S for so long I thought it was time for a slightly more advanced camera. Saw this and the reviews it was getting (along with all the customer images) and decided to get it. VERY pleased with it! There were a few moments when I was learning to work with the shutter speed and focusing that frustrated me, but after working with it more I got the hang of it. It's great straight out of the box and I love the miniature effect! The only downfall is finding it a case - doesn't fit in P&S and it's too small for a full-sized camera!
customer_reviews.author: tellemarie

customer_reviews.title: Good camera & good value
customer_reviews.text: For a point and shoot, this is a very good camera. The focus is very good and it takes good close ups. I find it easy to handle and use. Downsides are that it only has a wrist strap for the camera, I would like a neck strap...maybe they make one and I haven't found it yet. I bought Sanyo nimh rechargeable batteries for it and so far so good. I have not used the video feature yet. For the price it can't be beat. I had a Nikon point and shoot before and didn't like it. I'm glad to have a Canon again.
customer_reviews.author: LB Run

customer_reviews.title: Loving my new camera
customer_reviews.text: I have been taking photos with this new camera all through the holidays. It is fairly user friendly, but you really should spend some time experimenting with all of the features. I am very pleased with the quality of the photos, and especially the zoom focus. I have managed to take a number of great shots of birds with this camera. I would recommend this camera for it's features and the price, which I thought was right for all it had to offer.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: The best camera out there at this price range (worth way more then 200.00) The zoom is the best I have seen on a "point and Shoot"...even though this camera is more like an SLR then a true "point and shoot." Very pleased and would recommend it to pro and novice photographers alike. Way to many features to list...just buy it already, you wont be disappointed. Oh btw..it eats batteries so be prepared to purchase some rechargeable ones.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Dog

customer_reviews.title: Loses focus
customer_reviews.text: When I take movies with this, it loses focus during I am recording. I had a older version of PowerShot, and that never happened. So I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: TT's mom

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot
customer_reviews.text: Just to state right up front that I'm not a really great photographer. I bought the Canon PowerShot SX130IS for the optical zoom as my current Sony has only a 3x optical zoom. Having fun with this camera. No issues with the batteries ( I also purchased rechargable AA's since I know, in general how quickly cameras use regular alkaline batteries). I'm happy with my choice and would recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Book Happy

customer_reviews.title: Gr8 Cam, Gr8 Pix.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: high quality images at 20x zoom, excellent image stabilization, excellent night captures, long battery life, good quality video. Cons: cost, no continous capture mode I am running short of words to describe: For past 10 years that I have used Canon cams, this happens to be the best I owned so far. Had the feel of a DSLR in a regular cam.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera, overall
customer_reviews.text: I have been truly impressed by the quality of the pictures that this camera can take. My only disappointment is that the batteries seem to not last very long (about 2 weeks before I need to replace them). I do tend to take a lot of pictures but not enough to merit replacing good Duracell batteries every two weeks. I plan to try rechargeables to see if they hold up better.
customer_reviews.author: Chester0803

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera for the money..
customer_reviews.text: I previously had the SX110 model and I loved that camera. I am loving the 130 just as much. The photos I get from this camera are amazing, and that's on Auto mode. Loving the Fisheye and Miniature settings too. Of course the thing I love most is the optical zoom(on this model, it's 12x). I also like that the camera takes AA batteries. I have a DSLR as well but this camera will be my go to camera, much like the 110 was. For $249, you get a lot.Like I said, you can use the Auto mode, but you can utilize manual settings once you start feeling more confident. I'm giving the SX 110 to my mom...
customer_reviews.author: SMM2571

customer_reviews.title: Beware of internal hardware issues with this camera... check serial numbers!
customer_reviews.text: Loved the camera until it quit. After researching the problem I find that this particular serial number of Canon powershot cameras has internal hardware issues. Expensive repair. I feel like this was deliberately sold with a known problem. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: DebFlo

customer_reviews.title: Get a Go Pro
customer_reviews.text: I keep this with me everyday. A big complaint w/this unit is that it's a battery hog. True- but mostly with video functions. Never had a problem with single shot mode. No replacement for a pro camera but beats the hell out of the cell phone. Today the price is rediculous so shop it out. Today I'd get a GoPro
customer_reviews.author: J D

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX130IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 3.0-Inch LCD
customer_reviews.text: Very good product with intuitive controls. Pros: HD video excellent zoom great controls good picture saturation and colors 12x optical zoom Image stabilization picture modes uses AA-size disposable or rechargeable batteries Tons of preset effects Cons: Fixed LCD screen Uses only two AA batteries reducing the number of shots All in all an excellent camera to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Madbee

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works good when batteries are new, otherwise it's slow especially if you are using flash
customer_reviews.author: Itsme

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: My cousin in Australia had this camera and I really liked it. Easy to use, and made everyone in my photos look terrific. Auto lighting and shutter speed and facial focus work great. In fact, I can't emphasize enough how much better my pictures look. Great features that the camera does that I am still learning about - but you can also just pop some batteries in and go! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: William G.

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: great - love the wide angle. the pictures are clear and crisp. still working on learning the manual settings....not so easy. The camera is a bit heavy and large but that is the price you pay to have one that uses AA batteries versus the rechargable batteries of other cameras that often fail, are difficult to find replacements that then work worse than the original.
customer_reviews.author: Philadelphia City Dweller

customer_reviews.title: True PowerShot!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this camera. Spent a day out in misty weather taking macro shots and I couldn't be happier with the quality and images that I got!!! Still learning about all the different features... I'll figure them out as I play with it more. A VERY big plus for me is that it takes AA batteries. As a hiker it is important for me to know that I'll be able to have the battery power throughout my hike. This camera also provides great opportunity on the trail of being able to get the quality shot I want without the weight of a larger camera.
customer_reviews.author: ConstantMotion

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have 15 digital cameras and this is the sharpest except for my $2,000 Canon. Uses AA batteries so you always have power without charging and buying expensive Sony batteries This is very inexpensive but huge in the quality department. I have two.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for general use, easy to use though I think the controls could be a bit more intuitive. The video is very nice quality even close up; good sound. Not too heavy to hold steady in one hand. I really like that the flash has to be flipped up to fire; no more accidentally shooting flash when I want to be conserving battery power.
customer_reviews.author: Plaid Pantsuit

customer_reviews.title: Simple, lots of options, and great shots
customer_reviews.text: Always a great shot. Gets lots of good shots - great details. Why get any more pixels!? I love using the color enhancer - it makes images seem surreal. Love it. It always catches great pictures of FAST sport athletes. It blurrs if the event is at dusk, but you can get some great action shots with it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia B.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera except
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this camera, I was really excited. The problem I have is that not long after I got it, I started having problems with it focusing. The left side of the picture is always blurry no matter what I do. I try to keep the main part of my picture in the center and have to crop it to get the blurry part out of the way. It happens on every setting. Besides that, it has some neat features. I love the smile detector and love that I can take pictures at night.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Linn

customer_reviews.title: Totally Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I can not put into words about this camera! I've owned Canon Camera's from a 35mm print to my 1st digital being the Power Shot A-10 and then have owned several others (lost or given away for newer cameras). They just keep getting better and better. The ZOOM is unbelievable! My son has a Canon Rebel and I can say it takes almost as good of images as his Rebel.
customer_reviews.author: Dex662

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful camera!
customer_reviews.text: The best digital camera I have ever owned. I've even taken pictures of the super moon with it, they turned out far better than I thought I could capture. Easy to use and it's been everywhere with me. I love taking photos of animals, nature and landscapes. Great camera for just about anything!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl K

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for shooting activities
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife for Christmas because she works with the Girl Scouts as a trainer. She needed something that had a good zoom range to capture what is happening all around an event. Stabilization also seemed like a good feature for hectic activities. The SX130IS seems to fit the job perfectly. Haven't tried to use the video capability yet, but sounds like it will be a nice option.
customer_reviews.author: M. Francis

customer_reviews.title: great deal on a decent little camera
customer_reviews.text: I shoot my SX130 regularly using the CHDK hack which greatly enhances the usability of the camera. The only real "problem" I have with it is that it chews through alkaline AAs. But I bought a pack of 16 from CVS for $15 and so far I'm halfway through it. other than that, it's a great camera. Maybe not quite as good IQ-wise as my G9 but the lens reach is much better. buy and enjoy
customer_reviews.author: MoD-1

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: We had a canon 100 10x for several years, and worked fine until if fell off the table. The new one is even better. It is a 12x which allows her to take a picture from a distance without bothering anyone near by. The camera is simple to operate as it has a computer operation that allows it to automatically focus and set the proper aperture. It is almost fool proof.
customer_reviews.author: William J. philler

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera now for a few months and it far exceeded my expectations. My wife and I bought this camera to have something that would shoot more like our DSLR but not be near as bulky. This camera is only a few steps behind my Canon Rebel in the quality of photos we took. Optical zoom is the way to go! If you need a compact camera and don't want to give up high quality, go Canon, you'll never go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX130IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 3.0-Inch LCD
customer_reviews.text: Camera takes awesome pics. One reason for purchase was to be able to use camcorder with lighting in dark areas or at night, and I haven't yet found a way to accomplish this....cams real dark at night or dark lighting. HELP!
customer_reviews.author: Laura P

customer_reviews.title: A Good Bargain
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my wife as a birthday present. Neither she nor I are expert photographers. With the include instructions and the Auto setting we have been able to get some great shots and are hoping to get better. Easy to use, good zoom and fine pixel quality. Like most digital cameras it's a little hard on batteries, so we carry 4 rechargeables if we leave the house. No complaints! Would recommend this to anyone who is not in the market for a professional rig but wants quality candid/family photos.
customer_reviews.author: Truckpipe

customer_reviews.title: SX130is upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera to replace my wifes 110is which has been a quality work horse for a person who averages 200 shots a week, yes 200. She is very happy with the new camera and its upgrades. It is much the same unit with a better lens and more resolution. I use two Canon high end SLR cameras and this 130 captures as good or better pictures in most all situations. Best camera for the price on todays market.
customer_reviews.author: E. J. Deangeli

customer_reviews.title: Nice features
customer_reviews.text: I am not a camera wizard, but it seems like a quality camera for a low price. The one thing that I don't like is the zoom lever... could be a little bigger and in a better location. Rechargeable batteries are a must, but it is handy to be able to use regular batteries in a pinch. I would highly recommend this camera for anyone looking for an all purpose camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald E. Martin

customer_reviews.title: I love using it
customer_reviews.text: I won this camera a few years ago, and after a lens error that wouldn't quit, I decided to buy a new one, since these used ones are so inexpensive now. I love using it, and it's quite easy for the casual camera user.
customer_reviews.author: rf

customer_reviews.title: A little bulky but convenient
customer_reviews.text: This camera uses 2 AA batteries that are widely available. It's convenient when the electrical outlet is not available for recharging. It's a little bulky but if it fits in the shirt pocket. Outdoor pictures are sharp and clear but indoor pictures without adequate light are kind of blurry.
customer_reviews.author: Puffin

customer_reviews.title: and this one is the same and takes Awesome Pics and Vids
customer_reviews.text: Had one stolen.....and this one is the same and takes Awesome Pics and Vids.
customer_reviews.author: gocoastal

customer_reviews.title: my camera
customer_reviews.text: I have an older Canon, it still takes great pictures, but it was time to move on. I am very very pleased with my Power Shot SX130IS the zoom is great, the lens as always from Canon is flawless. Yesterday I used the full zoom to take a picture through a window of a cardinal that was perched across the street (100 feet away) When blownup you can see every feather!!! Just LOVE my new camera.
customer_reviews.author: P.A. De Voe

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I had already had one and knew it was a great camera. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I'm still learning how to use this camera but over all I love it and it takes great pictures. I read other reviews on Amazon and reviews from other sites about this camera and most of the reviews were 4-5 stars and highly recommended purchasing this camera. I have two friends were photograph as a hobby and both recommended I purchase this camera. So all in all I'm pretty happy and excited. I'm going to London in April and can't wait to take many photos. The memory card is sold separately and I didn't realize that when I purchased the camera but no big deal the camera is swanky compared to the camera's I've had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Liz D.

customer_reviews.title: Great as a Starter Camera for a Photography Student
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently enrolled in a digital photography class where we're learning to shoot in manual mode. I couldn't afford a DSLR (nor was I really sure that I'd be taking enough photos to justify the cost), and I needed a camera to use for this class. I read the reviews, and this was one of the few point and shoots that had full manual mode and a reasonable price. I'd highly recommend this camera for a beginning photography student. You'll be able to adjust all the things you need to adjust (exposure, shutter speed, manual focus), and you can take pretty decent photos.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: JudyO
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! It takes wonderful photos and the video is great! I did a great deal of research on this camera and I am so happy I purchased it. It has some manual functions that are exactly what is important to me. I am sure that anyone who purchases this camera will be very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: JudyO

customer_reviews.title: Canon SX130- outstanding camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 17-year-old daughter at about the same time as I bought a Canon G12 for myself for over twice the price. My daughter gets better pictures than I do! Especially when using the zoom. She even got an outstanding shot of the moon! I HIGHLY recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: ZimLarry

customer_reviews.title: Have had this camera for years and still love it
customer_reviews.text: Great shots, easy to use, a good fit in the hand. The only downside is the battery life, whenever connecting it to the computer it seems to really drain it. Also, in movie mode it picks up the sound of the zoom lens gears operating but, an all-in-one convenience makes it worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Sunkist

customer_reviews.title: Best Canon I've owned!
customer_reviews.text: This camera replaced my (stolen) G9, and I'm happy to say I like it even a bit better than the G9. It is quick, easy, and produces a high quality resolution that works well for me, as I am a graphic designer as well as photographer. Colors and clear and true. Great work, Canon!
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Wright

customer_reviews.title: Opinion on camera
customer_reviews.text: Repurchased this model camera...my original camera was stolen...great for my casual needs, easy to use and takes good photos. Only negative is short battery life...rechargeabe batteries improve that issue. Be informed, packaged deal (buy both camera and flash card for $xx may not be a good deal)
customer_reviews.author: picky

customer_reviews.title: A good camera but sometimes misses when in Zoom mode.
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's an excellent camera. The zoom sometimes misses and the picture comes out fuzzy, but most of the time the zoom works just fine. It takes only two AA batteries, which is great, but they get depleted pretty quickly, so you need to always carry at least another pair.
customer_reviews.author: J. Reader

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it eats power...but
customer_reviews.text: This is a great piece of engineering. Looking for photo quality, then low light performance, then optical zoom. Really effective AUTO mode, but a nice range of shooting options too. The retractable 12x zoom make this a good "compromise" camera. Well worth having a few extra sets of NiMH rechargables in the case.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but not awesome
customer_reviews.text: I took this camera to a convention recently and discovered it does not do well with taking action shots. It's awesome for still shots, granted, but I had lots of trouble if anyone moved at all in the pictures - they all came out blurry. I tried different settings with the same result. I'm a little bummed, but I'll keep the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M

customer_reviews.title: The power button is dead
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of the product for I like it. 2 of them have the power button malfunction. They are dead after average of 400 shoots each. 2 dead out of 3 is a very high ratio, that makes me think that the product has problem with the power button.
customer_reviews.author: AnhMy Tran

customer_reviews.title: All you need if your phone is not a supper duper one.
customer_reviews.text: I often leave my DSLR home. I have made great vacation videos with this. I use one charger and most of my electronics use AA batteries. Something that is not easy to find these days.
customer_reviews.author: Ferdosi

customer_reviews.title: perfect for business
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this particular camera because of the Consumer Report's review. It has lived up to the review wonderfully well. It is easy to use and makes a great photo. Very easy to download pics onto your computer with the SD card included.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Power Shot
customer_reviews.text: Very good camera for the price. I take many pictures that are job related and they are good quality. I send many pictures via on line connections and have good results.
customer_reviews.author: William F. Zeigler Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Canon produced yet another superb pocketable camera. It's been a constant companion for still and video clips.
customer_reviews.author: SP. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Great Lil Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera after ALOT of deliberation. Even though I wasn't too thrilled about the battery situation, I got it anyway. It is totally worth it! Just make sure you get rechargeable lithium batteries...You will save loads, I took like 50-60 pix and the low battery icon started flashing...that's the ONLY negative thing I have to say about this camera.
customer_reviews.author: yolanda

customer_reviews.title: Best camera in this price
customer_reviews.text: i am impressed again with canon. SX1301S is a winner without any doubt. i have clicked several pictures in different environments, different colors, different time. but in all the time it gave me same surprise. people could not believe few of my pics that i have taken from this cam. they thought i have downloded from internet from some professional website. it has so many features in built i could not imagine. for all occasion it has a feature and setting. if u really want to click good pics, just get one. hats off..
customer_reviews.author: S. Bhowmick

customer_reviews.title: my camera broke
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because mine (the same model) broke and I love all the features the Canon Powershot comes with. I did'nt want to buy new or different. The one I ordered came in mint condition! All the info the seller provided was correct. It was shipped in a timely matter and in it's original box.
customer_reviews.author: gloria dickison

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Litte Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I had one previously and lost it. I had gotten a digital SLR for a gift and that is a great camera. I like the Canon because you can take it with you when you don't want a full camera kit. I take a lot of barn and wild flower pictures. With the Canon I can grab it and shot. No set up, just point and shoot. I would highly recommend this little guy.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Swartzell

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent pocket camera. Very very easy to use. Takes excellant photos.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good camera. So easy to use. And even the owners manual is easy to use. I would recommend this camera for anyone wanting a smaller camera that takes good pictures and is easy to use. I love the Cannon products.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera earlier this year and this camera by far is my favorite. The photo quality is amazing. Yes the speed is slow to take the next pic but if you keep your finger down on the button, it will be ready within seconds. I have also used this camera in low lights and the photo quality is just amazing. I read a lot of people going thur batteries and I must say..I have not had that experience. I did get rechargable batteries and I have not any problems. My son is a kart racer and my action pics are just great. I am very very happy w/ my Cannon and will never get anything but a cannon....
customer_reviews.author: C. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Good Family Camera
customer_reviews.text: Pictures are very sharp and clear and experimented with all options. Liked fish eye, miniature modes alot. Gives pictures of professional looks. Experimented a lot indoors and pictures are not dull. Even captured running tap water droplets by experimenting with manual controls. Video quality also looks very good on camera play back eventhough I haven't yet uploaded it on to computer. A good camera for day to day family pictures. Bought enelopes rechargeable batteries in Costco for dollar 25 as suggested by other reviewers and works great. Cons: There is no panoramic sweep mode on this camera
customer_reviews.author: Silver Line

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like it---works good but can't get photos to load on computer---- fast service----
customer_reviews.author: StarrShine

customer_reviews.title: overall GooD~! for this small machine, but Battery is the inconvenience part
customer_reviews.text: The specs and photo quality are satisfying.. the mega pixels and 12x zoom in gives a good quality too! However, battery consuming is inconvenience, while normal AA (i have been using the Duracell AA batt) only last for only approximately 3 hours. Rechargeable battery should be considered to buy along with this product~ at first I tot there would be spared batteries that could be recharge come along with the camera, it's kinda upset when i see only 2 alkaline batteries are attached that could only last for couples of hours... =( but overall, the camera is awesome with clear display of wide screen~~ =)
customer_reviews.author: Sanique

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This camera is perfect for what I need, to take close ups of the moon.
customer_reviews.author: Bebe

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: This camera met my expectations and I've had no problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Avalon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This camera worked awesome until my x gf slamed it onto the concrete and broke it
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL LISLE

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is nice and overall a great value. I have not noticed the short battery life previously explained in reviews. I find the camera difficult to hold sometimes. The lens is so much bigger then a regular point and shoot so the camera s not square.
customer_reviews.author: Derek R. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: A great Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as a Christmas gift for my son and his wife. It arrived in plenty of time for use at Christmas and my son says he was taking great pictures using the camera right out of the box without reading the instructions. I couldn't ask for anything more.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera one year ago. I love it. There was reports about low battery life. I turned down the display brightness to 50%, which was still bright enough. This cured the problem. It has more functions then I'll ever use. I just like auto focus. What I like above the big camera's, you can put it your pocket. Well my pant pocket. Took a lot of pictures recently in California. Yosemite, Redwoods, Giant Sequoias, and SF. My pictures were just as good as my sons big camera.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for a Great Price!!
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love this camera!! Easy to use, great quality pictures, and just fun to use. Enjoy taking pictures with this camera. It takes great indoor shots, as well as outdoor shots. It's a great camera for someone who enjoys taking pictures of their pets as much as I do!!
customer_reviews.author: RobinD

customer_reviews.title: It's a great camera BUT EATS Batteries like they are M&Ms.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great camera BUT EATS Batteries like they are M&Ms. And rechargable NiCads only work in it when brand new. Once recharged the camera just says "REPLACE BATTERIES" once their recharged. HQRP AC Power Adapter for Canon PowerShot works OK if you are shooting from a static location like pics for ebay/Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mule

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot SX130IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 3.0-Inch LCD (OLD MODEL)
product_meta.description:
Canon's 4345B001 PowerShot SX130 IS 12.1 MP Compact Digital Camera is the perfect companion to all your good times. Now you can capture every detail of special moments in crisp, stunning 720p HD even while using the high-powered 12x wide-angle optical zoom. You'll record in stereo sound, then play back your videos instantly on you computer. The SX130 IS all about creativity, with fun new scene modes like Miniature Effect for Movies, and Fisheye Effect for artistically distorted stills. While you're having fun creating, the camera's Smart Flash Exposure and advanced Smart AUTO systems are ensuring that every image is the best it can be. Add the DIGIC 4 Image Processor, 12.1 megapixels and Optical Image Stabilizer, and you've got the ideal camera for making the good times last.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


 Smart, sleek and creative, the PowerShot SX130 IS is the perfect companion to all your good times. Now you can capture every detail of special moments in crisp, stunning 720p HD--even while using the high-powered 12x wide-angle optical zoom. You'll record in stereo sound, then play back your videos instantly on you computer. The SX130 IS is all about creativity, with fun new scene modes like Miniature Effect for Movies, and Fisheye Effect for artistically distorted stills. 



While you're having fun creating, the camera's Smart Flash Exposure and advanced Smart AUTO systems are ensuring that every image is the best it can be. Add the DIGIC 4 Image Processor, 12.1 megapixels and Canon's Optical Image Stabilizer, and you've got the ideal camera for making the good times last. 

Canon PowerShot SX130IS Highlights 

Shoot 720p HD video with stereo sound while using the optical zoom
The PowerShot SX130 IS is the perfect combination of still camera and extraordinary video maker. Videos are recorded in spectacularly detailed 720p HD with clear stereo sound. Better yet, you can now zoom in and out as your creativity demands, without losing a bit of the 720p HD resolution. Given the SX130 IS's powerful 12x wide-angle optical zoom, this capability is especially meaningful. 

12x wide-angle optical zoom with Optical Image Stabilizer
With precision engineering and decades of leadership in optics technology, Canon has created a bright, wide-angle lens that magnifies to an astonishing 12x. Moreover, it's sized to fit the SX130 IS's compact profile, performs at high speed, and keeps power consumption low. 


Whether you're at a sporting event, school play, or just out and about shooting, you'll love how the SX130's powerful wide-angle 12x optical zoom gets you up close fast and puts more image into every frame. And Canon's Optical Image Stabilizer controls camera shake to ensure that throughout the zoom range, your images are steady and crystal clear. 

Scene modes like Miniature Effect for Movie and Fisheye Effect offers creative options for videos and images
Explore your creativity! The PowerShot SX130 IS gives you fun, easy ways to play with perspective in your still images and videos, too. 

Miniature Effect for Movies (also available for still images) enhances perspective to give whatever you're shooting the fascinating look of a scene shot with miniature models. At the same time, selective frames are removed to enhance the effect when you play the scene back at 30 fps. 

"Fisheye" lenses are favorites of professional photographers: their quirky, convex perspective gives a fun creative punch to shots of kids, pets and more. The SX130 IS creates a Fisheye Effect without the need to attach a special lens--simply activate the mode, choose from three levels (low, medium and high) and shoot! 


Smart Flash Exposure determines the correct flash based on the shooting situation
Smart Flash Exposure is a technology that uses the proper flash by analyzing a wide range of lighting conditions, and helps ensure against over or underexposed images. The detail and color of your photo remain intact and truer to life even in challenging lighting. 

Advanced Smart AUTO selects from 28 predefined shooting situations
Just set the Canon PowerShot SX130 IS to Smart AUTO and you're ready for maximum enjoyment from your picture taking every time. It's a relaxing and satisfying way to shoot because you can completely concentrate on your subject, knowing that the camera has the technical details covered. Advanced Canon technology intelligently analyzes your situation and shooting conditions. Then it automatically selects an appropriate setting from 28 specially defined settings. So whether you're photographing flowers, a captivating sunset, or your friends at the park, you can be confident that you're getting dramatic, memorable images. 

With 22 Shooting Modes including 12 Special Scene Modes, you're ready for whatever shot comes your way. 

Capture amazing detail with 12.1-megapixel resolution Powerful DIGIC 4 Image Processor with 12.1 megapixels
The PowerShot SX130 IS is equipped with many of the same features as a higher-end camera: an ultra-powerful zoom, eye-popping resolution and advanced picture-improving technology. 12.1 Megapixels of resolution gives your photography incomparable depth and ensures that any section of any shot can be enlarged and cropped with no loss in quality when you edit the image even if you choose to print the image. It can create crisp, clear 13 x 19-inch posters. 

Canon's proprietary DIGIC Image Processors have long set its cameras apart from the competition, and the new DIGIC 4 sets the bar even higher. Faster, more accurate noise reduction delivers better image quality, even at high ISO speeds. 

Large 3.0-inch LCD with wide viewing angle
The camera's high resolution (230,000 dots) 3.0-inch LCD gives you the big picture, whether you're shooting, reviewing or showing off your images. This high-resolution screen offers a crisp, clear picture to make shooting, playback and using the camera's menu functions especially convenient. Clear and bright, it also features Night Display for easy viewing in low light. 

AA battery power enables you to easily power up
Conveniently, you don't need to worry about running out of batteries or having to recharge them. Since AA-size batteries can be purchased at any store, simply get new ones locally--wherever you go, no special power adapters or chargers are needed. 

What's in the Box  * PowerShot SX130 IS Camera body 
 * AA-size Alkaline Battery (x2) 
 * Wrist Strap WS-800 
 * AV Cable AVC-DC400ST 
 * USB Interface Cable IFC-400PCU 
 * Digital Camera Solution CD-ROM
feature_bullets: Shoot 720p HD video with stereo sound while using the optical zoom
High-powered 12x wide-angle optical zoom with Optical Image Stabilizer
Scene modes like Miniature Effect for Movie and Fisheye Effect; Advanced Smart AUTO
DIGIC 4 Image Processor, with 12.1 megapixels; 3.0-inch wide LCD
Capture images to SD/SDHC/SDXC memory cards (not included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars618 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
